name: CreateGithubDeploymentStatus
description:
Create deployment statuses for a GitHub deployment.

This tool allows users with appropriate permissions to create deployment statuses on GitHub for a specific deployment. It requires push access for users, and specific access scopes for GitHub and OAuth Apps. Use this tool to update the status of your deployments directly within GitHub repositories.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository. Case insensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: deployment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the deployment. This integer value specifies which deployment the status will be associated with.

value_schema.description: deployment_id parameter

parameters.name: deployment_status_state
parameters.description: The desired state of the deployment status. Options include: 'error', 'failure', 'inactive', 'in_progress', 'queued', 'pending', 'success'.

value_schema.description: The state of the status. When you set a transient deployment to `inactive`, the deployment will be shown as `destroyed` in GitHub.

parameters.name: status_description
parameters.description: A brief description of the deployment status, up to 140 characters.

value_schema.description: A short description of the status. The maximum description length is 140 characters.

parameters.name: deployment_environment
parameters.description: Specifies the target deployment environment, such as `production`, `staging`, or `qa`.

value_schema.description: Name for the target deployment environment, which can be changed when setting a deploy status. For example, `production`, `staging`, or `qa`.

parameters.name: deployment_environment_url
parameters.description: Sets the URL for accessing your deployment environment. Defaults to an empty string if not provided.

value_schema.description: Sets the URL for accessing your environment. Default: `""`

parameters.name: deployment_output_url
parameters.description: The full URL of the deployment's output. It replaces `target_url` and automatically sets `target_url` to the same value. Recommended for output logs.

value_schema.description: The full URL of the deployment's output. This parameter replaces `target_url`. We will continue to accept `target_url` to support legacy uses, but we recommend replacing `target_url` with `log_url`. Setting `log_url` will automatically set `target_url` to the same value. Default: `""`

parameters.name: deployment_status_target_url
parameters.description: Specify the URL containing output related to the deployment status. Note that it's recommended to use `log_url` instead, which replaces this parameter.

value_schema.description: The target URL to associate with this status. This URL should contain output to keep the user updated while the task is running or serve as historical information for what happened in the deployment. **Note:** It's recommended to use the `log_url` parameter, which replaces `target_url`.

parameters.name: add_inactive_status_to_previous_deployments
parameters.description: Specifies if an 'inactive' status should be added to prior non-transient, non-production deployments with the same repository and environment. Defaults to true.

value_schema.description: Adds a new `inactive` status to all prior non-transient, non-production environment deployments with the same repository and `environment` name as the created status's deployment. An `inactive` status is only added to deployments that had a `success` state. Default: `true`

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

value_schema.description: Adds a new `inactive` status to all prior non-transient, non-production environment deployments with the same repository and `environment` name as the created status's deployment. An `inactive` status is only added to deployments that had a `success` state. Default: `true`

Default: `""`
